name: pastorally
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
used to refer to the way religious and spiritual leaders do work that involves giving help and advice about religious, emotional, and social matters: I have a duty to pastorally help any parishioner who needs it. He was very busy pastorally, doing weekend parish work in remote villages.
UK used to refer to the way teachers do work that involves giving help and advice to students about personal matters, not just helping them with school work: Academically and pastorally, the school is almost beyond criticism. He warned that we must be careful about how we approach this issue with young people pastorally.
More examplesFewer examplesMany of them were theologically conservative, yet pastorally liberal.He was a devoted, pastorally concerned priest who was a sympathetic listener.
